intro: Artemisia genipi subsp. nivalis, commonly known as the alpine wormwood, is a perennial herb native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and mountainous environments. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
